title: The current meta is really fun
body: Atleast you cant blame the jungler for missing smite.

replies.body: I think you mean this:

actually i think the ability to have smite in lane makes the game more interesting. i dont even use it, but at leats its not every champion picking the same summoner every single game.

the thing is, you dont have to go smite in lane. i like to lane with ignite and it has its own advantages. especially when it comes to putting pressure on your opponent. so does tp have its own advantages, when it comes to global pressure.

now we just need to replace flash with mark/dash and we have actual variety in summoner spells. want escape? take ghost. want to make agressive plays? take mark/dash.

no crutch for bad plays anymore.
If mark/dash is introduced to SR, it would have to have a ridiculously long cooldown. Because a free engage every 17 seconds would just start a 5-man bruiser meta

> [{quoted}](name=Pyro Eclipse One,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oIylF3bE,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2015-07-14T16:10:10.847+0000)
>
> If mark/dash is introduced to SR, it would have to have a ridiculously long cooldown. Because a free engage every 17 seconds would just start a 5-man bruiser meta

it wouldnt have to be that ridiculous. of course it wouldnt be the same as on aram. but make it between 40 to 60 seconds without the reduced cooldown on dash and it would be fine.

if you have played aram recently, the poke comps are already overwhelming melee comps with snowballs again since the last nerf to the summoner. which makes me believe that its close to being balanced there.

i dont think it would be difficult to do on summoners rift.

> if you have played aram recently,

aram sucks.

>the poke comps are already overwhelming melee comps with snowballs again since the last nerf to the summoner. which makes me believe that its close to being balanced there.

Except that poke comps aren't overwhelming melee comps in current SR,sure as hell don't need buffs.

> i dont think it would be difficult to do on summoners rift.

Would be impossible.

Manbearswine here is completely correct. Man kind has figured out how to make mechanic prosthetic limbs that we can control with our own nervous system. We have gotten man into space. We have even grown human livers in a lab. But I'll be damned if you kids think that implementing mark/dash into a video game is even close to possible...that's just out of the realm of human ability. It is LITERALLY (and I am using this word correctly here) impossible to put it into this game, and balance it so that it would work well with any meta that is not 4 bruisers 1 tank.

An optimization problem without any good maxima isn't that farfetched.

You making a comparison between biomedical research and an optimization problem with fuzzy-at-best feedback? Now *that* is a stretch.

yea, so what? the thing can get blocked by minions and it can be dodged. if you adjust the range properly (like make it a medium range skillshot), it can be balanced.

dont forget, that aram works different due to how little space there is to evade skillshots that are flying around, that its a lot more confusing due to the snowballs having the same color as the background and all the other stuff you constantly need to evade, and 5 people clearing minion waves. so its more difficult to hide behind minions.

the idea is, that mark/dash would be a good summoner for quick aggressive plays and ghost would make for a good chase/escape summoner.

and as you noted, this summoner would probably help champions with low inbuilt mobility, that are having trouble right now more than it would help champs that already have a lot of mobility, as it would give them a window to make a play about every 40 to 60 seconds instead of only with flash.

on the flip side, theyd also be more vulnerable to getting caught out, as they cant use it very well as an escape.

It is a health item vs an armor item with similar passives.

Sunfire is most definitely an hp item as well. Cinderhulk doesn't pay off as early on a tanky bruiser or tank in the top lane when you get armor and even more health from sunfire from the getgo. Also, sunfire does more burn damage to minions and champs. Practically no reason to go hulk anymore after the changes as a toplaner imo.

I just don't see the point in it lol. Not to mention I'm not a fan of shen, the only thing I like about him is his ult, the rest of his kit is really boring to me. Not to mention there are tons of better late game tanks stat wise, cc wise, utility wise etc.

A good Shen is hard to deal with, because he can split push all day and team fight in a matter of seconds. True, he's not as good as a Sejuani or a Jarvan when it comes to team fighting, but that Stand United makes him scary all game, especially when paired up with a damaging carry.

For example, I remember on multiple occasions having a 2v5 alongside my carry and holding our own just fine. Not really common, but it proves my point about his potential as a dueling tank.

I have played so many games where the shen couldn't even land his taunt, he is the least threatening champ whenever I play top lane. Besides I like to play {{champion:75}} against him, so I outscale him and hardpush whenever he roams.

The invisible Righteous Glory aside, other than Warmog's there aren't exactly "health items."

Therefore Randuin's, Sunfire, and yes Spirit Visage are all "health items", contrasted with items like Frozen Heart, Thornmail, Banshee's Veil and Locket.
